      • getFriends

        public static java.util.List<Follower> getFriends(java.lang.String name,
                                                  int max)
        Pick some friends, consistently. This is a function: identical calls generate identical results.
        Parameters:
        name - Any name
        max - Maximum number of names to return
        Returns:
        about 5 names, up to max, chosen from a list of common names

        Pick some tweets (most of which are from Lifehacker, others from XKCD.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the twitter user
        max - Maximum number of tweets
        Returns:
        about 20 tweets, up to max, chosen from a list

      • getChoices

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getChoices(java.lang.String name,
                                                          java.lang.String[] choices,
                                                          int max,
                                                          int average,
                                                          boolean include_self)
        Generic graph generator, using a friend network as analogy. This is a function: identical calls generate identical results.
        Parameters:
        name - String used as a random seed.
        choices - Choices of 'friends'
        max - Maximum number of 'friends'
        average - lambda of friend count exponential distribution
        include_self - If `choices` contains `name`, should `name` be kept?
        Returns:
        About `average` names (up to `max`, but always at least 1), \ chosen from `choices`, except possibly `name` if it is in `choices` \ and `include_self` is false.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Debugging test function for Sample Data Generator This should be removed when Bridges is released.
        Parameters:
        args -
